meanings.definition: To bribe someone more than another person in order to gain an advantage.
meanings.sent1: He tried to outbribe his competitor by offering a larger sum of money.
meanings.sent2: The businessman attempted to outbribe his rival to secure the contract.
meanings.sent3: The student jokingly suggested he could outbribe his friend with extra cookies for the answers.
meanings.sent4: In the world of politics, candidates often try to outbribe each other for votes.
meanings.sent5: The image of the wealthy man trying to outbribe the officials stuck in everyone's minds.
